==Events==
* [[116]] &ndash; Emperor [[Trajan]] sends ''[[Laureate|laureatae]]'' to the [[Roman Senate]] at [[Ancient Rome|Rome]] on account of his victories and being conqueror of [[Parthia]].
*[[1249]] &ndash; [[André de Longjumeau|Andrew of Longjumeau]] is dispatched by [[Louis IX of France]] as his [[ambassador]] to meet with the [[Khagan]] of the [[Mongol Empire]].
*[[1270]] &ndash; [[Grand Duchy of Lithuania]] defeats the [[Livonian Order]] in the [[Battle of Karuse]].
*[[1630]] &ndash; Dutch forces led by [[Hendrick Lonck]] capture [[Olinda]] in what was to become part of [[Dutch Brazil]].
*[[1646]] &ndash; [[Battle of Torrington]], Devon &ndash; the last major battle of the first [[English Civil War]].
*[[1699]] &ndash; First [[Leopold I, Holy Roman Emperor|Leopoldine]] Diploma is issued by the [[Holy Roman Emperor]], recognizing the [[Greek Catholic]] clergy enjoyed the same privileges as [[Roman Catholic]] priests in the [[Principality of Transylvania (1570–1711)|Principality of Transylvania]].
*[[1742]] &ndash; [[Spencer Compton, 1st Earl of Wilmington|Spencer Compton]], [[Earl of Wilmington]], becomes [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|British Prime Minister]].
*[[1804]] &ndash; [[First Barbary War]]: [[Stephen Decatur]] leads a raid to burn the [[pirate]]-held frigate {{USS|Philadelphia|1799|6}}.
*[[1852]] &ndash; [[Studebaker]] Brothers wagon company, precursor of the [[automobile]] manufacturer, is established.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: General [[Ulysses S. Grant]] [[Battle of Fort Donelson|captures]] [[Fort Donelson]], [[Tennessee]].
*[[1866]] &ndash; [[Spencer Compton Cavendish, 8th Duke of Devonshire|Spencer Compton Cavendish, Marquess of Hartington]] becomes British [[Secretary of State for War]].
*[[1874]] &ndash; [[Dollar coin (United States)|Silver Dollar]] becomes legal US tender.
*[[1881]] &ndash; The [[Canadian Pacific Railway]] is incorporated by Act of Parliament at Ottawa (44th Vic., c.1).
*[[1899]] &ndash; [[Iceland]]'s first football club, [[Knattspyrnufélag Reykjavíkur]], is founded.
*[[1918]] &ndash; The [[Council of Lithuania]] unanimously adopts the [[Act of Independence of Lithuania|Act of Independence]], declaring [[Lithuania]] an independent state.
*[[1923]] &ndash; [[Howard Carter (archaeologist)|Howard Carter]] unseals the [[burial chamber]] of [[Pharaoh]] [[Tutankhamun]].
*[[1930]] &ndash; The [[Romanian Football Federation]] joins [[FIFA]].
*[[1934]] &ndash; The [[Austrian Civil War]] ends with the defeat of the [[Social Democratic Party of Austria|Social Democrats]] and the Republican [[Schutzbund]].
*[[1936]] &ndash; Elections bring the [[Popular Front (Spain)|Popular Front]] to power in [[Spain]].
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Wallace H. Carothers]] receives a [[United States]] [[patent]] for [[nylon]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Altmark Incident]]: The [[German tanker Altmark]] is boarded by sailors from the British [[destroyer]] {{HMS|Cossack}}. 299 British prisoners are freed.
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: [[Red Army]] troops re-enter [[Kharkov]].
*  1943   &ndash; World War II: Insertion of [[Operation Gunnerside]], Norway.
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: American forces [[Battle of Corregidor (1945)|land on]] [[Corregidor Island]] in the [[Philippines]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; The "[[Toddlers' Truce]]", a controversial [[television]] close down between 6.00&nbsp;pm and 7.00&nbsp;pm is abolished in the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Fidel Castro]] becomes Premier of [[Cuba]] after dictator [[Fulgencio Batista]] was overthrown on [[January 1]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; The U.S. Navy submarine {{USS|Triton|SSRN-586|6}} begins [[Operation Sandblast]], setting sail from [[New London, Connecticut]], to begin the first submerged circumnavigation of the globe.
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Explorer program]]: [[Explorer 9]] (S-56a) is launched.
*  1961   &ndash; The [[DuSable Museum of African American History]] is chartered.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[North Sea flood of 1962|Flooding]] in the coastal areas of [[West Germany]] kills 315 and destroys the homes of about 60,000 people.
*[[1968]] &ndash; In [[Haleyville, Alabama]], the first [[9-1-1]] emergency telephone system goes into service.
*[[1978]] &ndash; The first [[computer]] [[bulletin board system]] is created ([[CBBS]] in [[Chicago, Illinois]]).
*[[1983]] &ndash; The [[Ash Wednesday fires|Ash Wednesday bushfires]] in [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] and [[South Australia]] kill 75.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Hezbollah]] is founded.
*[[1986]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] liner {{MS|Mikhail Lermontov||6}} runs aground in the [[Marlborough Sounds]], [[New Zealand]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; The trial of [[John Demjanjuk]], accused of being a [[Nazism|Nazi]] guard dubbed "Ivan the Terrible" in [[Treblinka extermination camp]], starts in [[Jerusalem]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Nicaragua]]n [[Contras]] leader [[Enrique Bermúdez]] is assassinated in [[Managua]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[China Airlines Flight 676]] crashes into a road and residential area near [[Chiang Kai-shek International Airport]] in [[Taiwan]], killing all 196 aboard and seven more on the ground.
*[[1999]] &ndash; In [[Uzbekistan]], a bomb explodes and gunfire is heard at the government headquarters in an apparent [[assassination]] attempt against [[President]] [[Islam Karimov]].
*  1999   &ndash; Across [[Europe]], [[Kurd]]ish rebels take over embassies and hold hostages after [[Turkey]] arrests one of their rebel leaders, [[Abdullah Öcalan]].
*[[2005]] &ndash; The [[Kyoto Protocol]] comes into force, following its [[Ratification#Ratification of an international treaty|ratification]] by [[Russia]].
*  2005   &ndash; The [[National Hockey League]] [[2004–05 NHL lockout|cancels]] the entire 2004-2005 regular season and playoffs.
*[[2006]] &ndash; The last [[Mobile Army Surgical Hospital]] (MASH) is decommissioned by the [[United States Army]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; A [[February 2013 Quetta bombing|bomb blast]] at a market in [[Hazara Town]] in [[Quetta]], [[Pakistan]], kills more than 80 people and injures 190 others.
